intro: Psychotria plicata, commonly known as the zigzag psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, wavy-leaf margins and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in shaded, moist environments. Psychotria plicata is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of alkaloids.
